item.source: Where can i learn to do the java ja?

item.title: Where can i learn to do the java ja?
item.dc:creator: @imafatmess imafatmess
item.description:
@imafatmess wrote:

Or, look at any of these sites (and yes, I did compile all these sites together into this list myself):

Sean Greasley (a well known site on many forums wich has video tutorials for many languages, including java):
www.seangreasley.com

One of the many sets of java tutorials from sun microsystems:
http://java.sun.com/docs/books/tutorial/index.html

Huge java tutorial site (I read quite a bit but got bored not even quarter way through. It’s very longwinded!):
http://chortle.ccsu.edu/java5/cs151java.html

Pascal to java tutorials:
http://www.geocities.com/SiliconValley/Park/3230/pas/pas2java.html

My GUI tutorial for swing… made by me!:
http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,2007.0.html

IRC bot tutorials (On the left toolbar you should find them):
http://www.jibble.org

Game tutorial for applets:
http://www.javacooperation.gmxhome.de/indexEng.html

Space Invader Game (tutorial for exactly as I said. It is not for in applets):
http://www.planetalia.com/cursos/

Where to download java (you must download the “JDK 0.5 Update 6” then you must install it):
http://java.sun.com/j2se/1.5.0/download.jsp

Java IDE’s

Text Pad (Easiest for begginners):
http://www.textpad.com

Eclipse (hard to understand if you havent done any scripting in java before):
http://www.eclipse.org

Java Books

Big Java (This is a great book. It is excedingly big and has about 1100 pages):
http://www.amazon.co.uk/exec/obidos/ASIN/0471697036/qid=1139253053/sr=8-1/ref=sr_8_xs_ap_i1_xgl/202-4221776-9495044

Read full topic
